results.title: The Battleship Potemkin [DVD]
results.brief_description: Originally made to celebrate the 20th anniversary of the unsuccessful 1905 Russian Revolution, this film portrays the mutiny aboard the Russian battleship Potemkin and the role of the sailors and citizens of the Port of Odessa in the abortive revolution of 1905. It brought to the attention of the world the theories of Sergei Eisenstein, his emphasis on montage and his stress on the individual as protagonist.

results.title: The Battleship Potemkin
results.brief_description: This full length version of one of the most important films in the history of silent cinema portrays the mutiny aboard the Russian battleship Potemkin and the role of the sailors and citizens of the Port of Odessa in the abortive revolution of 1905. It brought to the attention of the world the theories of Sergei Eisenstein, his emphasis on montage, stress on intellectual content and his treatment of the mass instead of the individual as protagonist. Suitable for Upper Secondary-Tertiary level students.
results.description: This full length version of one of the most important films in the history of silent cinema portrays the mutiny aboard the Russian battleship Potemkin and the role of the sailors and citizens of the Port of Odessa in the abortive revolution of 1905. results.title: The Battlers
results.creator_credit: Gus Howard, South Australian Film Corporation and George Ogilvie
results.brief_description: Based on the novel of the same name by Kylie Tennant this made for television mini-series is set in Australia during the Great Depression. It focuses on the friendship between two ‘battlers’, Dancy, an orphan who has spent most of her life on the streets and Snow, a taciturn man on the rebound from a failed marriage. Forced to travel the country in search of work, like many working-class Australians of the time, and surviving mainly on dole book rations, their lives are full of hardship and deprivation, but the comradeship they develop on the road also brings them many moments of comfort and happiness. Cast includes Audine Lieth, Marcus Graham, Anne Phelan, Gary Sweet and Jacqueline McKenzie.

results.title: The Battle of Wangapore
results.brief_description: In this satirical animation British troops under a typical Colonel Blimp test the turbanned and rebellious riff-raff from over the border and all with a stiff sense of propriety. The story tracks back to the good old days on the North West Frontier of India. An example of animation technique as used by an amateur production group. Animation by Richard Horn and Ken Clark. (See also Title Code 006110 “Let battle begin” for the history of the making of the cartoon.)

results.title: The Battle of San Pietro
results.creator_credit: United States. Army Pictorial Service and John Huston
results.brief_description: Presents modern warfare from the soldier’s point of view. Stresses the number of men killed in taking one military objective. Shows how in the Allies Italian campaign, the people of San Pietro were too stunned to realise they had been liberated.

results.title: The Battle of Russia
results.creator_credit: Frank Capra, Anatole Litvak and United States. Office of War Information. Overseas Operations Branch
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Why we fight”.
This epic film unfolds the great history of Russia, and the defeat of Hitler’s Nazi armies. The depiction of the mightiest battle in war history, with a human life toll of 20 million Russians and 10 million Germans, becomes more than a first hand record of war; it is also an ode to a people’s courage and self sacrifice, and the end of Hitler’s “Mein Kampf”. Historic film sequences of “The Seige of Leningrad” features the miracle of a “frozen lake” which becomes a rescue highway for a city surrounded and doomed, an event which turned the tide of World War II.

results.title: The Battle of Midway
results.creator_credit: John Ford and United States. Dept. of the Navy
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Why we fight”.
John Ford’s Academy Award winning documentary filmed during the Battle of Midway. Narration combines with visuals of the naval air battle, hospitalization of the injured and burial services in a patriotic tribute to the people from the United States battling the Japanese. Suitable for Tertiary level students.

results.title: The Battle of China
results.creator_credit: Frank Capra and United States. War Dept.
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Why we fight”.
An intriguing story which explores China’s 4000 year historical culture, it’s vast and rich lands, and its most abundant asset - human manpower. Japan’s total commitment to conquer, rule and utilise China’s resources, in order to control Asia, begins with a rebel ring which masks Japan’s Royalty. The psychological mesmerising of the masses, and Japan’s invasion of the world’s longest surviving civilisation, culminates in the terrifying aspects which may have altered the world history forever. Recalls Chinese development of the compass, printing, astronomy, gunpowder and porcelain.

results.title: The Battle of Britain
results.creator_credit: Frank Capra, Anthony Veiller and United States. Office of War Information. Overseas Operations Branch
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Why we fight”.
Illustrates the German air attack on Britain, particularly London, by the use of film shot during World War II. The role of civilians in the Battle of Britain is highlighted. Concentrates on the Blitz in London and Coventry after Dunkirk, combining actuality footage with many extracts from fiction films. This film is credited with reducing anti-British sentiment among American forces.

results.title: The Battle of Billy's pond (Captioned)
results.brief_description: When enthusiastic young fisherman, Billy, and his friend, Cobby, find their favourite pond polluted with dead fish floating on the surface, they decide to investigate. The boys discover that the pond has been poisoned by industrial waste. Based on the book by Howard Thompson.
